intro: Pouteria asterocarpon, commonly known as the starfruit or carambola, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized tree that belongs to the Sapotaceae family. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers. Its fruit is distinctive, with a pentagon shape and a sweet, tangy flavor. The botanical features of Pouteria asterocarpon make it both ornamental and economically valuable.
